cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing NNW today, turning NW and slowing, then approaching and stalling along the middle Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Rockport-Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch north of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Matagorda to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely at the port beginning late Friday with a 55 % chance of occurrence; brief hurricane-force gusts are possible if the core drifts closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises in Galveston Bay/Houston Ship Channel could reach 2–4 ft above ground at high tide, causing low-level wharf flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 30 inches possible, posing a major freshwater-flood risk for terminal areas and land-side transport links.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy seas and dangerous swells in the ship channel; extended port closure potential because the cyclone may stall near the coast, leading to multiple days of hazardous conditions.
